code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:white M aged 24 Ys presents with moderate nausea since hitting the front of the head a short time ago. he also reports severe headache, mild vomiting, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the moderate nausea. he had 6 min LOC. o:Height 76 in, Weight 136 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 18, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: , CT Head ( - ) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive
ICB , MRI Brain Unremarkable , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex , appears

Value.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:white male student aged 24 ys presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 6 min). he denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. he denies smoking Patient reports that he never drinks alcohol o:Height 75 in, Weight 133 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=95,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=42.1,Reaction Time=0.51, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,
